ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook the noodles according to the package instructions.
Julienne the carrot and slice the bell peppers into thin strips.
Heat olive oil in a pan, add minced garlic, and sauté briefly.
Add the carrots and peppers, sautéing for 5-7 minutes until slightly tender.
Mix in the cooked noodles and soy sauce, stirring well.
Season with salt and black pepper, and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
servingSuggestion: Serve the vegetable noodle stir-fry warm, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

instructions: Melt the chocolate and butter using a double boiler.
In a bowl, whisk the eggs and sugar until fluffy.
Slowly incorporate the melted chocolate mixture into the eggs, stirring constantly.
Sift in the flour and baking powder, mixing until smooth.
Fold in the walnut pieces gently.
Pour the batter into a greased baking dish and bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (356°F) for 25-30 minutes.
servingSuggestion: Slice the brownie and serve with a scoop of vanilla ice cream for an irresistible treat.

instructions: Grate the zucchinis and squeeze out excess water.
Heat olive oil in a pan, add the grated zucchini, and sauté for 5-7 minutes.
Crush the garlic and mix it into the yogurt.
Combine the sautéed zucchini with the yogurt, then season with salt and black pepper.
Transfer to a serving dish and sprinkle with fresh dill.
servingSuggestion: Serve the yogurt zucchini salad chilled, perfect as a refreshing starter.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Marinate the chicken breast with olive oil, salt, and black pepper, then cook in a skillet.
Chop the lettuce and place it in a large bowl.
Add the croutons, parmesan cheese, and sliced chicken.
In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, mustard, and olive oil to make the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss well before serving.
servingSuggestion: Enjoy the Chicken Caesar Salad as a light main course or a satisfying side dish.

instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth.
Pour the milkshake into glasses and top with chocolate chips.
Serve immediately and enjoy the chocolatey goodness!
servingSuggestion: Perfect for a summer treat, pair it with a dollop of whipped cream for extra indulgence.

instructions: Soak the rice in warm water for 20 minutes, then drain.
Dice the chicken breast into small pieces.
In a pot, heat butter and vegetable oil, then sauté the chicken until lightly browned.
Add the rice and sauté for 3-4 minutes.
Pour in the chicken broth, salt, and black pepper, then stir and cover with a lid.
Cook on low heat until the liquid is absorbed. Let it rest for 10 minutes before serving.
servingSuggestion: Serve the chicken pilaf garnished with freshly chopped parsley for a delightful meal.

instructions: Preheat the oven to 220°C (425°F).
Roll out the pizza dough and spread the tomato sauce evenly over it.
Sprinkle mozzarella cheese on top and add basil leaves.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle a pinch of salt.
Bake for 10-15 minutes until the crust is golden and cheese is melted.
servingSuggestion: Serve hot with a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil for added flavor.

instructions: Chop the tomatoes, onion, and garlic.
Melt butter in a pot, then sauté onion and garlic until fragrant.
Add the tomatoes and vegetable broth, cooking for 10 minutes.
Blend the mixture until smooth and return to the pot.
Stir in the heavy cream, then season with salt and pepper.
Simmer for 5 minutes and serve warm.
servingSuggestion: Serve with a side of crusty bread or garlic croutons.

instructions: In a bowl, mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and baking soda.
In another bowl, whisk buttermilk, egg, and melted butter.
Combine the wet and dry ingredients, stirring until smooth.
Heat a non-stick pan and pour a ladle of batter.
Cook until bubbles appear, then flip and cook the other side.
Repeat with the remaining batter.
servingSuggestion: Serve with maple syrup, fresh berries, or a dollop of whipped cream.

instructions: Peel and boil the potatoes until tender.
Mince the garlic and sauté it in butter.
Mash the potatoes and mix in the garlic butter.
Add milk, salt, and pepper, stirring until creamy.
servingSuggestion: Serve as a side dish for roasted chicken or steak.

ingredients: Toppings: granola, chia seeds, fresh fruits
instructions: Blend avocado, banana, spinach, almond milk, and honey until smooth.
Pour into a bowl and add your favorite toppings.
Serve immediately and enjoy the creamy goodness!
servingSuggestion: Perfect for a quick and nutritious breakfast or snack.

instructions: Mix crushed graham crackers with melted butter and press into a cake pan.
In a bowl, beat cream cheese, powdered sugar, and vanilla extract.
Whip the heavy cream and fold into the cream cheese mixture.
Spread the filling over the crust and refrigerate for 4 hours.
Top with fresh strawberries before serving.
servingSuggestion: Slice and serve chilled for a creamy dessert experience.

instructions: Mix cabbage, carrots, bell peppers, and soy sauce in a bowl.
Place a spoonful of the mixture in each wrapper and roll tightly.
Heat oil in a pan and deep-fry the spring rolls until golden.
Drain excess oil and serve hot.
servingSuggestion: Serve with sweet chili sauce or soy dip for extra flavor.
